column4: Could someone explain to me how to compile programs in ubuntu? Particularly C, as I'm having issues. I'm really not used to the linux/ubuntu platform. I'm a formal windows user, but have moved on to linux because supposedly it's a more natural environment for programming! Thanks
type cc mysource.c -o myexecutable -Wall?
are you trying to compile someone else's package, or are you trying to compile your own C program?
all I've done thus far is write a simple program using gedit, called samp.c, I've also tried to compile it with the terminal but no luck
gcc: samp.c: No such file or directory
gcc: no input files
samp.c is on my desktop btw if that means anything
you need to be in the same directory as the file, so type "cd Desktop"
miles@ubuntu:~$ cd desktop
bash: cd: desktop: No such file or directory
ehh
use captial D
it's case-sensitive
ahh ok i've changed directories to desktop now
now try that gcc command; when you're done, type ls, which should show a new file, "samp", which you can run with ./samp
Okay nice!
I hope I can remember how to do all of that in the future! :D
oops
didnt mean to do that lol
what does ls stand for??
How do I delete programs I no longer need? also I dont like having my programs on my desktop :< Is there a way I can change where they're saved?/
click on Places > Home and make a folder in your home directory
